reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful good location
reviews.text: stayed here for five days was expecting the worst after reading various reviews...the rooms where tiny but not a problem...there was clean bedding which is a must for me and the bathroom was clean also apart from a little rust or mildew that occurred in the shower floor...didn't like the lighting in the room we had no light and had to make do with a table lamp to light the whole room wasn't to pleased with this but coped...location is fantastic a couple minutes from the beach and right in the middle of all the stores...admittedly this hotel suits younger holiday makers for it can be quite noisy in the night time…we had numerous Rap battles going on in the middle of the night next door to us but found it quite entertaining…would use hotel shelly again wasn't too bad for the very cheap rates we paid suits .
I can honestly say I've never stayed anywhere worse than the Shelley. Apart from all the other issues described (bugs, bad AC, terrible staff, awful breakfast) we had a very frightening experience.
reviews.title: Hell - worst place I've ever stayed

reviews.text: The first night we were there was fine. The second night, all hell broke loose. Unbeknownst to us, it was Spring Break. Being Australian, we had no concept of this phenomenon. There were hundreds of people pouring in and out of the hotel in search of the free vodka that the bar so generously served.
reviews.title: horrible horrible place

reviews.text: We went out for dinner, and when we arrived back at the hotel we attempted to go to sleep. At about midnight, yelling across the hallway commenced. The yelling and door slamming went on for four hours, it appeared that someone had locked themselves in their room. The rooms are not blocked from the bar, so there were about 6 different people running up and down the stairs yelling and banging doors. The door leading from the hallway was repeatedly slammed into the wall, right behind our beds.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed!
The Worst Treatment and Service Ever!!!
reviews.text: We were terrified during this ordeal - I was afraid to leave the room and could not see what was happening as there was no spyhole in the door. I tried to call reception 3 times - the phone was not working.

We stayed here one night for $83 with taxes & fees. Our room was very nice, though it lacked the stereo that was supposed to be there. Breakfast was there, but wasn't much. The best thing about this hotel in my opinion is the open bar between 19-20, and the boutique feel it has.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel

reviews.text: Upon check-out they wanted to charge us extra fees for water & electricty. I refused and eventually they let it go.
reviews.title: Avoid the Shelley

reviews.text: My husband and I booked a weekend at the Shelley on-line through their web site. We specifically reserved the king suite with jacuzzi as it was on the top floor at the rear of the hotel and would be quiet ( we usually go to bed by midnight and SoBe can be noisy until well past 4 am). We drove down from Orlando and arrived at 3:30 pm. The kid working at the front desk could not find our reservation and told us that the king suite was already reserved by another party. We had him call the manager, who called their reservation dept. and they found our reservation. Since we had already pre-paid the room for two nights and the other party hadn't yet arrived, they gave us the room. We got the keys but when we opened the door, it became apparent that the previous tenants were still there and had left all their things in the room. So now the room was triple booked. The manager said that there was nothing he could do; the hotel was fully booked and he couldn't evict the previous tenants. They put us up at one of the group's other hotels in a smaller room directly over the lobby/bar, fronting the street directly across from a nightclub. Not a quiet room. The first night wasn't so bad, but the next night they booked a private party until after 1 am. The music was so loud that when I called down to complain, they said they couldn't hear me over the music and I needed to yell. The whole experience was one screw up after another by these people. I would avoid the entire chain in the future.
reviews.title: Fun & hip beach hotel
Hated it!
reviews.text: I've stayed here 4 or more times over the past 5 years. Each time I return they update and renovate the lobby and outside areas which is a great plus. The hotel is really close to the beach, its across the street and a 1/2 block up. Total walking time 4 minutes...So its close..The hotel doesnt serve food but there is this deli that serves the best sandwiches and smoothies ever. A must try!! If you cross the street to the left of the hotel and walk up towards the beach its right there on the corner, i think thats 8th & collins.. Its a about a 3min walk. There are tons of places to eat here, and lots of shopping on the block. Banana, the gap, sephora & Armani are all on the same block as the hotel. Barneys & Roxi are next door.

This hotel is great for people who just want to have a comfy & clean place to sleep with good service and inexpensive hotel fees. This hotel has a great bar, that has happy hour, but beware its only with cheap house vodka. A good goose martini can be about $12-14, which is expected in SOBE anyway. The rooms are small yes but come with an awesome CD player, the beds were made and cleaned nicely, the bathroom doesn't have a shower curtain its one of those new step in showers thats has granite tiles and is glassed in. No counter space in the bathroom but one shelf for cosmetics. The maid took awhile to come to clean the room. But whose in the room all day anyway when your on vacation.Other than that things were fine, hallways are a bit dark, they have the whole dim light thing going on in the halls so watch your step. Front Desk staff, is usually pleasant & helpful during checkin and giving passes for nightclubs. So all and all, if your looking to come down to SOBE with your friends to hang out and party or chill this hotel is great. If you are expecting to have lots of amenities and want a romantic weekend away stay at the Eden Roc or Courtyard Oceanfront both of which i have stayed in and have had a wonderful time. I hope this helped! :)
reviews.title: Best Deal In South Beach-- can Not beat the Shelley
Not bad considering other hotels in area
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel one night. The room was small but comfortable. The linen was clean with four pillows on the bed. The curtain in the room would not cover the whole window and the blinds did not work so we improvised. The safety latch on the door was installed upside down.

reviews.title: Not half bad

reviews.title: Horrible experience
reviews.text: The gentleman at the desk was friendly. The breakfast did not seem very good so we went around the corner and ate outdoors at the Waldorf Tower and enjoyed the early morning beach scene.

reviews.title: Shelly, first and las time....
reviews.text: The hotel is a little over a block from the beach.

reviews.title: Fine for what it is
reviews.text: Considering flights arrive at various times of the day the rigid check-in and check-out time did not seem very friendly. We ended up walking around for hours in the clothes we flew in on.

reviews.title: Hated It!
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weekend in South Beach. We stayed at the Hotel Shelley. The pictures on the website are NOT accurate pictures of their rooms. They neglect to tell you that they are in the middle of a major renovation. Outside of that, the hotel is infested with bugs. Not sure what bug it was, but it had wings. So they would fly around the room and later shed their wings everywhere. The towels in the bathroom were infested with the bugs. The shelf attached to the mirror was covered with wings. We switched rooms, and after having the room cleaned the next day, the bugs were there again. Flying,on the bed, on the ceiling, on the lampshade, in the bathroom, EVERYWHERE. The Front Desk Clerk gave us the option of trying another room, but when we went to check it we found the bugs crawling on the sheets. The clerk was nice enough to waive the resort fees and other daily surchages, but we have yet to hear from the manager in regard to a refund.

reviews.title: False Advertising for Clean
reviews.text: The Hotel Shelley is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at! You are paying strictly for location. We were moved after our first night because we woke up to termintes crawling all over us and flying all around the room. The 2nd room had a 3 inch cockroach in the shower. At $125 a night for a weekend "retreat" - I expect a clean room. The reception staff could have cared less after we reported the bugs. Only 1 hotel employee seemed remotely concerned and finally moved us to the 2nd room. The light in the bathroom was about as bright as a candle- forget putting on makeup. I have stayed at nicer places in Mexico or Spain. I had much higher expectations for this hotel in the "ritzy" South beach area. The website for the hotel is deceiving. The continental breakfast was pathetic - bread and OJ - or coffee and cereal. Forget that is is advertised as being "free". You are charged an extra $5 a day resort charge that helps for the breakfast. Our TV didn't even work. I felt like we were "roughing it". Not a very relaxing vacation hotel. I would not recommend anyone stay here no matter what your budget. The free airport shuttle only services Miami Airport- most hotels service Ft. Lauderdale as well. Forget parking. The valet service offered was $20/24 hrs.

reviews.title: Not even One Star
reviews.text: While the hotel is definitely basic, it is not clean. The level of dirt, mildew, odor, and bug infestation crosses the line and would be considered unhealthy in anyone's opinion. Style, comfort and personalized service are certainly a stretch.
